stories.headline: Year after attacks files still guarded
stories.author_title: Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press
stories.summary: Federal agencies removal of information from web sites post-9/11 hampers journalists' access, with new legislation potentially restricting more data.

stories.headline: Databases add depth to school stories
stories.summary: Journalists are encouraged to use databases to add depth to school reporting, with the No Child Left Behind Act increasing the need for detailed education stories.

stories.headline: Data shows cronyism in schools
stories.summary: An investigation reveals how taxpayer dollars benefit lobbyists and contractors instead of students in Miami-Dade County Public Schools.

stories.headline: Changes with Uplink, Database Library
stories.author_title: NICAR and Missouri School of Journalism
stories.summary: Uplink undergoes changes to coordinate better with The IRE Journal, highlighting the importance of analytic mapping and 'Bits & Bytes'.

stories.headline: Building a database for tracking state money
stories.summary: An investigation into state political party finances reveals the challenge of compiling information and the critical role of databases in understanding soft money flows.
